intro: Chorizanthe staticoides f. bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate desert sandflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and hairy, succulent leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its flowers are typically pink to purple in color, and it produces small, dry fruits that disperse seeds by wind. This species is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability, making it a resilient component of desert ecosystems.
